00044 /*
00045     This API is used to facilitate binding code written in C to script
00046     objects.  The API in this header does not assume the presence of a
00047     user agent.  That is, it can be used to bind C code to scripting
00048     environments outside of the context of a user agent.
00049     
00050     However, the normal use of the this API is in the context of a
00051     scripting environment running in a browser or other user agent.
00052     In particular it is used to support the extended Netscape
00053     script-ability API for plugins (NP-SAP).  NP-SAP is an extension
00054     of the Netscape plugin API.  As such we have adopted the use of
00055     the "NP" prefix for this API.
00056 
00057     The following NP{N|P}Variables were added to the Netscape plugin
00058     API (in npapi.h):
00059 
00060     NPNVWindowNPObject
00061     NPNVPluginElementNPObject
00062     NPPVpluginScriptableNPObject
00063 
00064     These variables are exposed through NPN_GetValue() and
00065     NPP_GetValue() (respectively) and are used to establish the
00066     initial binding between the user agent and native code.  The DOM
00067     objects in the user agent can be examined and manipulated using
00068     the NPN_ functions that operate on NPObjects described in this
00069     header.
00070 
00071     To the extent possible the assumptions about the scripting
00072     language used by the scripting environment have been minimized.
00073 */
00074 
00075 #define NP_BEGIN_MACRO  do {
00076 #define NP_END_MACRO    } while (0)
00077 
00078 /*
00079     Objects (non-primitive data) passed between 'C' and script is
00080     always wrapped in an NPObject.  The 'interface' of an NPObject is
00081     described by an NPClass.
00082 */
00083 typedef struct NPObject NPObject;
00084 typedef struct NPClass NPClass;
00085 
00086 typedef char NPUTF8;
00087 typedef struct _NPString {
00088     const NPUTF8 *UTF8Characters;
00089     uint32_t UTF8Length;
00090 } NPString;
00091 
00092 typedef enum {
00093     NPVariantType_Void,
00094     NPVariantType_Null,
00095     NPVariantType_Bool,
00096     NPVariantType_Int32,
00097     NPVariantType_Double,
00098     NPVariantType_String,
00099     NPVariantType_Object
00100 } NPVariantType;
00101 
00102 typedef struct _NPVariant {
00103     NPVariantType type;
00104     union {
00105         bool boolValue;
00106         int32_t intValue;
00107         double doubleValue;
00108         NPString stringValue;
00109         NPObject *objectValue;
00110     } value;
00111 } NPVariant;
00112 
00113 /*
00114     NPN_ReleaseVariantValue is called on all 'out' parameters
00115     references.  Specifically it is to be called on variants that own
00116     their value, as is the case with all non-const NPVariant*
00117     arguments after a successful call to any methods (except this one)
00118     in this API.
00119 
00120     After calling NPN_ReleaseVariantValue, the type of the variant
00121     will be NPVariantType_Void.
00122 */
00123 void NPN_ReleaseVariantValue(NPVariant *variant);
00124 
00125 #define NPVARIANT_IS_VOID(_v)    ((_v).type == NPVariantType_Void)
00126 #define NPVARIANT_IS_NULL(_v)    ((_v).type == NPVariantType_Null)
00127 #define NPVARIANT_IS_BOOLEAN(_v) ((_v).type == NPVariantType_Bool)
00128 #define NPVARIANT_IS_INT32(_v)   ((_v).type == NPVariantType_Int32)
00129 #define NPVARIANT_IS_DOUBLE(_v)  ((_v).type == NPVariantType_Double)
00130 #define NPVARIANT_IS_STRING(_v)  ((_v).type == NPVariantType_String)
00131 #define NPVARIANT_IS_OBJECT(_v)  ((_v).type == NPVariantType_Object)
00132 
00133 #define NPVARIANT_TO_BOOLEAN(_v) ((_v).value.boolValue)
00134 #define NPVARIANT_TO_INT32(_v)   ((_v).value.intValue)
00135 #define NPVARIANT_TO_DOUBLE(_v)  ((_v).value.doubleValue)
00136 #define NPVARIANT_TO_STRING(_v)  ((_v).value.stringValue)
00137 #define NPVARIANT_TO_OBJECT(_v)  ((_v).value.objectValue)
00138 
00139 #define VOID_TO_NPVARIANT(_v)                                                 \
00140 NP_BEGIN_MACRO                                                                \
00141     (_v).type = NPVariantType_Void;                                           \
00142     (_v).value.objectValue = NULL;                                            \
00143 NP_END_MACRO
00144 
00145 #define NULL_TO_NPVARIANT(_v)                                                 \
00146 NP_BEGIN_MACRO                                                                \
00147     (_v).type = NPVariantType_Null;                                           \
00148     (_v).value.objectValue = NULL;                                            \
00149 NP_END_MACRO
00150 
00151 #define BOOLEAN_TO_NPVARIANT(_val, _v)                                        \
00152 NP_BEGIN_MACRO                                                                \
00153     (_v).type = NPVariantType_Bool;                                           \
00154     (_v).value.boolValue = !!(_val);                                          \
00155 NP_END_MACRO
00156 
00157 #define INT32_TO_NPVARIANT(_val, _v)                                          \
00158 NP_BEGIN_MACRO                                                                \
00159     (_v).type = NPVariantType_Int32;                                          \
00160     (_v).value.intValue = _val;                                               \
00161 NP_END_MACRO
00162 
00163 #define DOUBLE_TO_NPVARIANT(_val, _v)                                         \
00164 NP_BEGIN_MACRO                                                                \
00165     (_v).type = NPVariantType_Double;                                         \
00166     (_v).value.doubleValue = _val;                                            \
00167 NP_END_MACRO
00168 
00169 #define STRINGZ_TO_NPVARIANT(_val, _v)                                        \
00170 NP_BEGIN_MACRO                                                                \
00171     (_v).type = NPVariantType_String;                                         \
00172     NPString str = { _val, (uint32_t)(strlen(_val)) };                        \
00173     (_v).value.stringValue = str;                                             \
00174 NP_END_MACRO
00175 
00176 #define STRINGN_TO_NPVARIANT(_val, _len, _v)                                  \
00177 NP_BEGIN_MACRO                                                                \
00178     (_v).type = NPVariantType_String;                                         \
00179     NPString str = { _val, (uint32_t)(_len) };                                \
00180     (_v).value.stringValue = str;                                             \
00181 NP_END_MACRO
00182 
00183 #define OBJECT_TO_NPVARIANT(_val, _v)                                         \
00184 NP_BEGIN_MACRO                                                                \
00185     (_v).type = NPVariantType_Object;                                         \
00186     (_v).value.objectValue = _val;                                            \
00187 NP_END_MACRO

00190 /*
00191   Type mappings (JavaScript types have been used for illustration
00192     purposes):
00193 
00194   JavaScript       to             C (NPVariant with type:)
00195   undefined                       NPVariantType_Void
00196   null                            NPVariantType_Null
00197   Boolean                         NPVariantType_Bool
00198   Number                          NPVariantType_Double or NPVariantType_Int32
00199   String                          NPVariantType_String
00200   Object                          NPVariantType_Object
00201 
00202   C (NPVariant with type:)   to   JavaScript
00203   NPVariantType_Void              undefined
00204   NPVariantType_Null              null
00205   NPVariantType_Bool              Boolean
00206   NPVariantType_Int32             Number
00207   NPVariantType_Double            Number
00208   NPVariantType_String            String
00209   NPVariantType_Object            Object
00210 */
00211 
00212 typedef void *NPIdentifier;
00213 
00214 /*
00215     NPObjects have methods and properties.  Methods and properties are
00216     identified with NPIdentifiers.  These identifiers may be reflected
00217     in script.  NPIdentifiers can be either strings or integers, IOW,
00218     methods and properties can be identified by either strings or
00219     integers (i.e. foo["bar"] vs foo[1]). NPIdentifiers can be
00220     compared using ==.  In case of any errors, the requested
00221     NPIdentifier(s) will be NULL. NPIdentifier lifetime is controlled
00222     by the browser. Plugins do not need to worry about memory management
00223     with regards to NPIdentifiers.
00224 */
00225 NPIdentifier NPN_GetStringIdentifier(const NPUTF8 *name);
00226 void NPN_GetStringIdentifiers(const NPUTF8 **names, int32_t nameCount,
00227                               NPIdentifier *identifiers);
00228 NPIdentifier NPN_GetIntIdentifier(int32_t intid);
00229 bool NPN_IdentifierIsString(NPIdentifier identifier);
00230 
00231 /*
00232     The NPUTF8 returned from NPN_UTF8FromIdentifier SHOULD be freed.
00233 */
00234 NPUTF8 *NPN_UTF8FromIdentifier(NPIdentifier identifier);
00235 
00236 /*
00237     Get the integer represented by identifier. If identifier is not an
00238     integer identifier, the behaviour is undefined.
00239 */
00240 int32_t NPN_IntFromIdentifier(NPIdentifier identifier);
00241 
00242 /*
00243     NPObject behavior is implemented using the following set of
00244     callback functions.
00245 
00246     The NPVariant *result argument of these functions (where
00247     applicable) should be released using NPN_ReleaseVariantValue().
00248 */
00249 typedef NPObject *(*NPAllocateFunctionPtr)(NPP npp, NPClass *aClass);
00250 typedef void (*NPDeallocateFunctionPtr)(NPObject *npobj);
00251 typedef void (*NPInvalidateFunctionPtr)(NPObject *npobj);
00252 typedef bool (*NPHasMethodFunctionPtr)(NPObject *npobj, NPIdentifier name);
00253 typedef bool (*NPInvokeFunctionPtr)(NPObject *npobj, NPIdentifier name,
00254                                     const NPVariant *args, uint32_t argCount,
00255                                     NPVariant *result);
00256 typedef bool (*NPInvokeDefaultFunctionPtr)(NPObject *npobj,
00257                                            const NPVariant *args,
00258                                            uint32_t argCount,
00259                                            NPVariant *result);
00260 typedef bool (*NPHasPropertyFunctionPtr)(NPObject *npobj, NPIdentifier name);
00261 typedef bool (*NPGetPropertyFunctionPtr)(NPObject *npobj, NPIdentifier name,
00262                                          NPVariant *result);
00263 typedef bool (*NPSetPropertyFunctionPtr)(NPObject *npobj, NPIdentifier name,
00264                                          const NPVariant *value);
00265 typedef bool (*NPRemovePropertyFunctionPtr)(NPObject *npobj,
00266                                             NPIdentifier name);
00267 typedef bool (*NPEnumerationFunctionPtr)(NPObject *npobj, NPIdentifier **value,
00268                                          uint32_t *count);
00269 typedef bool (*NPConstructFunctionPtr)(NPObject *npobj,
00270                                        const NPVariant *args,
00271                                        uint32_t argCount,
00272                                        NPVariant *result);
00273 
00274 /*
00275     NPObjects returned by create, retain, invoke, and getProperty pass
00276     a reference count to the caller.  That is, the callee adds a
00277     reference count which passes to the caller.  It is the caller's
00278     responsibility to release the returned object.
00279 
00280     NPInvokeFunctionPtr function may return 0 to indicate a void
00281     result.
00282 
00283     NPInvalidateFunctionPtr is called by the scripting environment
00284     when the native code is shutdown.  Any attempt to message a
00285     NPObject instance after the invalidate callback has been
00286     called will result in undefined behavior, even if the native code
00287     is still retaining those NPObject instances.  (The runtime
00288     will typically return immediately, with 0 or NULL, from an attempt
00289     to dispatch to a NPObject, but this behavior should not be
00290     depended upon.)
00291 
00292     The NPEnumerationFunctionPtr function may pass an array of
00293     NPIdentifiers back to the caller. The callee allocs the memory of
00294     the array using NPN_MemAlloc(), and it's the caller's responsibility
00295     to release it using NPN_MemFree().
00296 */
00297 struct NPClass
00298 {
00299     uint32_t structVersion;
00300     NPAllocateFunctionPtr allocate;
00301     NPDeallocateFunctionPtr deallocate;
00302     NPInvalidateFunctionPtr invalidate;
00303     NPHasMethodFunctionPtr hasMethod;
00304     NPInvokeFunctionPtr invoke;
00305     NPInvokeDefaultFunctionPtr invokeDefault;
00306     NPHasPropertyFunctionPtr hasProperty;
00307     NPGetPropertyFunctionPtr getProperty;
00308     NPSetPropertyFunctionPtr setProperty;
00309     NPRemovePropertyFunctionPtr removeProperty;
00310     NPEnumerationFunctionPtr enumerate;
00311     NPConstructFunctionPtr construct;
00312 };
00313 
00314 #define NP_CLASS_STRUCT_VERSION      3
00315 
00316 #define NP_CLASS_STRUCT_VERSION_ENUM 2
00317 #define NP_CLASS_STRUCT_VERSION_CTOR 3
00318 
00319 #define NP_CLASS_STRUCT_VERSION_HAS_ENUM(npclass)   \
00320         ((npclass)->structVersion >= NP_CLASS_STRUCT_VERSION_ENUM)
00321 
00322 #define NP_CLASS_STRUCT_VERSION_HAS_CTOR(npclass)   \
00323         ((npclass)->structVersion >= NP_CLASS_STRUCT_VERSION_CTOR)
00324 
00325 struct NPObject {
00326     NPClass *_class;
00327     uint32_t referenceCount;
00328     /*
00329      * Additional space may be allocated here by types of NPObjects
00330      */
00331 };
00332 
00333 /*
00334     If the class has an allocate function, NPN_CreateObject invokes
00335     that function, otherwise a NPObject is allocated and
00336     returned. This method will initialize the referenceCount member of
00337     the NPObject to 1.
00338 */
00339 NPObject *NPN_CreateObject(NPP npp, NPClass *aClass);
00340 
00341 /*
00342     Increment the NPObject's reference count.
00343 */
00344 NPObject *NPN_RetainObject(NPObject *npobj);
00345 
00346 /*
00347     Decremented the NPObject's reference count.  If the reference
00348     count goes to zero, the class's destroy function is invoke if
00349     specified, otherwise the object is freed directly.
00350 */
00351 void NPN_ReleaseObject(NPObject *npobj);
00352 
00353 /*
00354     Functions to access script objects represented by NPObject.
00355 
00356     Calls to script objects are synchronous.  If a function returns a
00357     value, it will be supplied via the result NPVariant
00358     argument. Successful calls will return true, false will be
00359     returned in case of an error.
00360     
00361     Calls made from plugin code to script must be made from the thread
00362     on which the plugin was initialized.
00363 */
00364 
00365 bool NPN_Invoke(NPP npp, NPObject *npobj, NPIdentifier methodName,
00366                 const NPVariant *args, uint32_t argCount, NPVariant *result);
00367 bool NPN_InvokeDefault(NPP npp, NPObject *npobj, const NPVariant *args,
00368                        uint32_t argCount, NPVariant *result);
00369 bool NPN_Evaluate(NPP npp, NPObject *npobj, NPString *script,
00370                   NPVariant *result);
00371 bool NPN_GetProperty(NPP npp, NPObject *npobj, NPIdentifier propertyName,
00372                      NPVariant *result);
00373 bool NPN_SetProperty(NPP npp, NPObject *npobj, NPIdentifier propertyName,
00374                      const NPVariant *value);
00375 bool NPN_RemoveProperty(NPP npp, NPObject *npobj, NPIdentifier propertyName);
00376 bool NPN_HasProperty(NPP npp, NPObject *npobj, NPIdentifier propertyName);
00377 bool NPN_HasMethod(NPP npp, NPObject *npobj, NPIdentifier methodName);
00378 bool NPN_Enumerate(NPP npp, NPObject *npobj, NPIdentifier **identifier,
00379                    uint32_t *count);
00380 bool NPN_Construct(NPP npp, NPObject *npobj, const NPVariant *args,
00381                    uint32_t argCount, NPVariant *result);
00382 
00383 // Helper function for evaluating a script in the scope of the NPObject passed in.
00384 // Parameters
00385 // npp
00386 //  The plugin's opaque instance handle (Can be NULL)
00387 // popups_allowed
00388 //  Indicates if popups created in the context of the script being executed are
00389 //  blocked or not.
00390 // npobj
00391 //  The NPObject.
00392 // npscript
00393 //  The script being executed.
00394 // result
00395 //  On return contains the value returned by the script.
00396 // Returns true on success.
00397 bool NPN_EvaluateHelper(NPP npp, bool popups_allowed, NPObject* npobj, 
00398                         NPString* npscript, NPVariant *result);

00409 /*
00410     NPN_SetException may be called to trigger a script exception upon
00411     return from entry points into NPObjects.  Typical usage:
00412 
00413     NPN_SetException (npobj, message);
00414 */
00415 void NPN_SetException(NPObject *npobj, const NPUTF8 *message);
